themes: underrepresentation of women of color in film direction
gatekeeping and homogeneity among funders and producers
economic barriers and lack of generational wealth
potential for Austin to become a hub for filmmakers of color
lack of access and connections in established film centers
key_phrases: Women of color only account for 3% of Hollywood's directors
the overwhelming majority of white men who fund and produce our media
they're spending more money on movies that share their point of view
the market is not their mirror
POC film audiences actually outspend their counterparts
Hollywood is losing an estimation of $10 billion per year over a lack of representation
We don't have the connections in LA nor the generational wealth to move there
Money and access are our top barriers
what if Austin offered POC and female filmmakers both?
If ACME was intentional with this mission... it would be a moneymaker for the city and for its most underserved artists
barriers_identified: lack of representation among directors and producers
lack of industry connections in LA
insufficient access to money and resources
solutions_proposed: Austin becoming the top indie filmmaking hub for artists of color
ACME intentionally supporting POC and female filmmakers, even if coded for political purposes
